Thanks for the fix.
The R4.5.1patched and the R-devel version now allow me to download packages

We are alas well aware that the deprecated option wininet might fail us
anytime... Yet, we haven't find a way so far to make libcurl work behind our
proxy on Windows PC. 
We tried almost everything we could find on stackoverflow posts.
Nevertheless, I'll give it another try soon :wink:. Do not hesitate to give me any
tips you could have.

Thanks again,
Camille

*[Bug 18945] download.file.method parameter set in options() not taken into account by install.packages() in R4.5.1*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18945>

--- Comment #3 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Hi Camille,

thanks for the confirmation of the fix.

Re libcurl and a corporate proxy on Windows, it would be great if you could
analyze the problem and report so that it could be fixed, or at least the
concrete cause is known.  If you haven't already, please see what
?download.file says about proxies with libcurl (for example, how to make sure
libcurl finds about the proxy settings, see also
R_LIBCURL_SSL_REVOKE_BEST_EFFORT). If that doesn't help, one thing you can try
is making it work with command-line curl using their official builds for
Windows, possibly resolving any issue there first, and then reporting back to R
(in principle you can use external curl also with R, but if it turns out we
need to enable more libcurl settings in R, we could do that). Unfortunately,
this is a problem where some iterations and debugging needs to be done on the
user end - as external developers (of libcurl, R) won't have access to the
proxy.

*[Bug 15925] caret stuck*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=15925>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
           Severity|minor                       |trivial
             Status|ASSIGNED                    |CLOSED
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
                 CC|                            |tomas.kalibera@gmail.com

--- Comment #3 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Thanks for the report, fixed in R-devel.

The problem was caused by a caret position reset when drawing a line including
carriage return - it would always re-set the position to be at the end of the
line. I've changed Rgui console to instead take \r into account when computing
the width of the prompt part of the line.

As a work-around in released versions of R, one can simply press enter to get a
new prompt on an empty line, where editing would work normally.
